title: Filipa Patão shared her thoughts on becoming the inaugural head coach of Boston Legacy FC
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Filipa Patão, former Benfica manager, now leads Boston Legacy FC as its inaugural head coach, aiming to build a new legacy.

title: Jeremy Swayman feels like a ‘completely different human being’ a year removed from contract dispute
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jeremy Swayman signs eight-year, $66 million contract with the Bruins, participating fully in training camp after last year's dispute.

title: Elizabeth Banks cast as Karen Read: What readers said about the limited series role
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Elizabeth Banks, a Pittsfield native, will star as Karen Read and executive produce the Prime Video limited series.

title: 2 New England casinos just ranked the best in the U.S. (that aren’t in Las Vegas)
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Mohegan Sun in Uncasville ranked No. 2, and Foxwoods Resort Casino in Mashantucket ranked No. 3 in USA Today's list.

title: What to know about Seisiún, the two-day Irish music festival coming to Boston
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Seisiún features Dropkick Murphys and The Pogues at Suffolk Downs, Boston, with The Pogues making their first U.S. appearance in 20+ years.
One-day tickets range from $75 to $257, with limited parking and a designated rideshare area near Suffolk Downs.
Celebrate the spirit of Ireland in Boston with a diverse lineup of Irish and Irish-American artists at Seisiún this weekend.

title: 44 proposed Mass. ballot questions, including rent control, move to next step — and 3 don’t make the cut
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Attorney General Andrea Campbell announced 44 proposed Massachusetts ballot questions will advance in the process, leaving three initiatives behind.

title: Juvenile with ‘airsoft replica weapon’ determined to have caused UMass Lowell lockdown
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A juvenile with an airsoft replica weapon caused a three-hour lockdown at UMass Lowell, prompting a large law enforcement response.
